fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34795].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a user with a username that has square brackets, e.g "pborkowski \[Atlassian\]". 9/4/18 Update: Or hashtag, e.g "gonzi-gonzoTEST#1"

# Attempt to @-mention that user in a comment.

*Expected result:* The user will be @-mentioned as normal.

*Actual result:* The result will look like [~pborkowski [Atlassian]] and the user will not get a mention notification.

 9/4/18 Update:
- Username _username#_ is valid: 
The user profile is retrieved by the user picker and it will be shown as the user Full Name linked to the JIRA profile page: https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=username%23 .
- Username _user#name_ is not valid: 
The user profile is retrieved by the user picker but it will be shown as the JIRA username (~user#name) not linked to the JIRA profile page: https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=user%23name .
fields.summary: Unable to @-mention users with square brackets in their username - updated on 09/04/18 : Also impacting username with hashtag (#) in it, (work only if the hashtag is the last character of the username)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34793].
  {panel}

Customers are commonly finding the difference between the IS EMPTY and != options in JQL to be confusing.

For example, if I do a search for issues where AnimalField != Cat will return results where AnimalField is set to Dog, but not where that field is empty. 

Essentially the != operator means this field has a value, but the value is not Cat.

Many customers find themselves expecting it to mean "Does not equal or is empty", they try to understand why this behaviour isn't working as expected and hit up the docs, which do say it, but kind of hidden away. Could we add a section to call this out a bit louder?

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching
fields.summary: Highlight the differences between IS EMPTY and != in JQL Advanced Searching Docs
Link comment with it's emitted state

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34777].
  {panel}

The Web Resource context page in the Developer documentation currently lists defined contexts for the Create Issue and View Issue pages (*jira.create.issue* and *jira.view.issue*, respectively):

* *[https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Web+Resource+Plugin+Module]*

However, if a custom field type requires JavaScript on both the Create and Edit screens, the *jira.general* context must be used instead, since there is no context for the Edit screen.

Please add a new context to complete the set.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34763].
  {panel}

Need a easier way to include non-null values in jira

I tried raising my concern with my colleague (Sthanunathan for JSP-164449) , however my idea did not get conveyed correctly.

Given that Jira is used by functional tester who do not have to be masters in SQL I suggest that when JSQL gets a query like

select * from jiraissue where FixedVersion!= 'Version2.4.0';

-where FixedVersion can take in null values - jira should internally convert it to 

select * from jiraissue where isNull(FixedVersion,-1) != 'Version2.4.0';

I tried this

key in (RETT-2236, RETT-2595) AND isnull(fixversion,-1) != RETT-Backlog

And got the below exception:

Error in the JQL Query: 'isnull' is a reserved JQL word. You must surround it in quotation marks to use it in a query. (line 1, character 431)

I have a work around, as suggested by you, 
key in (RETT-2236, RETT-2595) AND (fixversion != RETT-Backlog OR fixVersion is EMPTY)

but the problem is that the user does not have the schema to always know whether its a null field OR not.

Hence what I request is:
If there is a query like this from the front end:
select * from jiraissue where FixedVersion!= 'Version2.4.0';

-where FixedVersion can take in null values - always convert it internally to 

select * from jiraissue where isNull(FixedVersion,-1) != 'Version2.4.0';
fields.summary: Need a easier way to include non-null values in jira
Provide a quick filter results gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34753].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
While creating an issue, and you mention a user in the issue's *description*, a notification for the mention is not sent out. The notification will only be sent out *if you mention the user after the issue is created*, but not during issue creation. 

In this screenshot [^Notification2.jpg], the notification is sent only after I have mentioned the user after the issue has been created. The first mention was not sent out.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create an issue in a JIRA instance that has outgoing mail configured.
# In the description field while creating the issue, mention a user using the "@mention" function.
# Create the issue.

*Expected Result*
JIRA would send out a notification for issue creation as well as one to the user mentioned in the description.

*Actual Result*
JIRA sends out only a notification to confirm issue creation.
fields.summary: Mentioning users in the issue description on issue creation does not send out notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34746].
  {panel}

Hi support,

when querying a specific issue with the jira rest api through the endpoint

rest/api/latest/issue/{issueIdOrKey}

the resulting object includes only the first 20 worklogs in the "workload"-property. The "comments"-property includes always all available comments. In our case we need to get all worklogs in the result and based on the fact, that comments are handled differently I think there should be a consistant solution.

*Steps to reproduce*:

1. create issue
2. create 21 worklogs
3. call the rest api endpoint for an issue
4. result is, that the worklog-property does only contain 20 worklogs instead of 21

Question has been posted in the support forum:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/208332/all-worklogs-for-an-issue-through-issue-end-point?page=1

Thanks

*Update* :

When encountering this bug, when trying to query for a specific work log ID that is after the first 20 work log, it will return error that it can't find the specific work log ID. This happens even though if the specific work log ID information is in the database.
fields.summary: Result for Issue rest api and Webhooks call returns only the first 20 worklogs

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34742].
  {panel}

Currently there's no way to set a "default" issue security scheme that would be used for all new projects that are created in JIRA, that's very inconvenient.

There should be a mechanism to do that, the same as it works with Permission Schemes.

Related Atlassian Answers thread:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/159702/default-issue-security-scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34688].
  {panel}

Jira currently only support a single domain.
With the introduction of the Enterprise level of subscription, the lack of multiple domains really damper the notion of Enterprise.

Jira should fully support multi domain within its project, add  a permission category "belong to domain" to restrict project to be only visible under a  domains or a domains group. Notifications should use the default domain assigned to a project.

Why? Here is a use case.

Company A use a public Jira to give their client a way to report issues.
The company grow and purchase company B, company C and company D, each having their own Jira.
Company A want to consolidate Jira, as their teams have merged. It would be counter productive to manage 5 instances of Jira, to have their customer to create account on 2 or 3 instance of Jira to follow ticket and to quintuple the hardware and database.

By having multiple domain, the company could merge the 5 jira into one, consolidate all the user into 1 instance and keep the domains associated to the merged company.

Customer from jira.companyC.com will still be able to access their project, not seeing the project from jira.companyB.com unless they acces it through the proper domain.

The users handling the request can also kept track of the domain, or with proper permissions, access all project from any domain.


THIS feature would give Jira Enterprise true enterprise level.

I hope this will remain open to allow people interested in this feature to vote for it.
Thanks
fields.summary: Alow Jira to support multiple domains with permissions
Display Post Functions when a transition is performed

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34673].
  {panel}

Add Permission named "Ability to Edit Own Tickets" and rename "Ability to Edit Tickets" to "Ability to Edit All Tickets".

|| Was || Need ||
| Ability to Edit Tickets | Ability to Edit All Tickets |
| \- | Ability to Edit Own Tickets |

Do this in the way like it made with comments editing permissions.

In the current permission scheme of JIRA there is no possibility to doesn't allow to users/developers to modify tickets text that they did not created. It was not so trouble when tickets editing was only by clicking "EDIT" button (previous major versions of JIRA). But current version of JIRA (v6.x) is allowing to edit tickets just by clicking on the text (easy-to-use mode).

Also, there is no any needs to allow other developers to change a ticket that you had wrote. For example, permissions may be configured in the following way:
|| Permission || Groups/Roles/Users ||
| Ability to Edit All Tickets | jira-administrators, jira-managers, Project Lead |
| Ability to Edit Own Tickets | jira-users |
fields.summary: Add Permission named "Ability to Edit Own Tickets" and rename "Ability to Edit Tickets" to "Ability to Edit All Tickets"

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34647].
  {panel}

A simple switch in confluence instance base url would break the confluence gadget in JIRA dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# jira url:jira.com:8080, confluence url: wiki.com:8090
# Configure the application links with trusted or OAuth
# Add a confluence QuickNav gadget in JIRA with the following URL:
{code}
http://wiki.com:8090/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:gadget-search/gadgets/gadget-search.xml
{code}
# Add the gadget and configure spaces, pages
# The gadget should review the pages correctly.
# Proceed to Confluence and switch the base url to mywiki.com:8090


h3. Actual Result:

The gadget in JIRA dashboard throws error when it unable to reach the old url.
{code}
Requests to http://wiki.com:8090/rest/gadget/1.0/pagegadget/getrenderedpage.json?pageId=917506 are not allowed. See your administrator about configuring a whitelist entry for this destination (http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KQfCDQ ).
{code}

h3. Expected Result:

It seems to be intended behaviour which the gadget rely on the gadget url. However, there are chances that the url of the instance may be change and switch. 

It's a painful process for customer to add the gadget again to their dashboard and the approach unable to edit the gadget for all users at one time.

For better customer experience, the following suggestion can be implemented:
* Allow customer to modify the gadget url that added into JIRA through the gadget list so they don't have to add the gadget again. Otherwise, may possible to allow the gadget to work dynamically so it can detect the url of the instance automatically.
* Create a better integration in terms of adding cross platform gadget. For instance, customer can authenticate first so he has the rights to select a application and add the gadgets into JIRA. The interface can be similar to issue linking interface.
fields.summary: Better handling of changes to the base url for external gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34624].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently our documentation instructs how create a self-signed certificate using keystore type as *JKS*, configure the SSL connector and check the certificate as in this [excerpt|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS?src=search#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-ConfiguringyourwebserverusingtheJIRAconfigurationtool] of our documentation.

h3. The problem
The problem is that there are others keystore types, such as *PKCS12* for example and when using JIRA configuration tool to insert the SSL configuration, it will always define keystore type as *JKS* into the {{server.xml}}.

If we want to define a different keystore type, the only option available is manually edit it into the {{server.xml}} file. It would be much easier if we had a field to adjust this setting in JIRA configuration tool.
fields.summary: Include an option to define keystoreType when using JIRA configuration tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34619].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

As of now, JIRA does not have the ability to read LDAP password policy and inform their registered users regarding the password policy in place in the LDAP server.

It would be great if JIRA has the ability to recognize the password policy set in the integrated LDAP server and use that information to inform/warn their users.

For example:

When a user password almost expired, JIRA could inform the customer and ask them to change their password trough the correct procedure.

Another example, is when JIRA has the ability to write into LDAP server, it could specifically inform the users if the password set by them is incorrect based on the password policy in place.
fields.summary: JIRA to recognize LDAP Password Policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34592].
  {panel}

People sometimes comment on JIRA items purely via the 'comment' action; at other times, their comment is made as part of another change to the issue. In the latter case, the context of their comment is often highly dependent on the action they are performing at a time. For example, in a comment made from a smart commit message, the comment is usually a description of the code commit being made. This breaks up the flow of the comments and often makes it difficult to unscramble what people are talking about.

It would be great if comments that were made in the context of other actions (such as reassigning issues, editing metadata, smart commits) were annotated in some way with an indication of the action. I believe that Bugzilla does this.

I could use the Activity tab to see the context of a comment, but the comment text in this tab is too small for everyday use. A little annotation in the Comments tab would really help.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Annotate comments with the action that generated the comment

Every time we create an issue in JIRA through the "Create Issue" screen we can see a button located at the top right corner of the pop up called "Configure Fields" - by clicking this button we can see the "Where is my field?" option.

!pop_up.png!

However, this it not true when creating a new ticket from JIRA's administrative area, instead JIRA opens the screen on the page and does not open the pop up window. There is no "Configure Fields" inside this page nor the "Where is my field?" option.

!page.png!
fields.summary: "Where is my field?" option doesn't appear when creating issue from administrative area

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34583].
  {panel}

First I have to say, that I like all Atlassian product. Especially because of the well integration between your products. It is easy to find relevant information and navigate between the systems. E.g I can navigate from Jira to a Bamboo build regarding the selected issue. Or I can see the build and test results of Bamboo in my build tab of the issue. Perfect!!
I think the reason is, that the Atlassian strategy wants to make things easier.

No I found something which conflicts with your concept regarding Stash
* I have an Issue and the regarding code changes in an Git Branch.
* Now I have created a Pull Request in Stash and of course somebody should review my changes.
* The review was successful and I have merged the branch into the master over Stash.

PERFECT usability, but:
From the Jira-Issue view:

* Where can I see that the Pull request was approved?
* Where is the "green/red color" which indicates the state?
* How can I navigate directly to the relevant Pull request? The number is available, but not a link. I can navigate to everything (Project, Repository, Source, Commit) but not the important Pull-Request. It is possible to navigate from the Pull request to the issue but not from the issue to the Pull request.

I can not believe that this is not implemented..... This follows not the Atlassian strategy "Make things easier"

I hope this functionality will come soon. It is a must...
fields.summary: Stash status (Merged and Approved) & Pull request link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34582].
  {panel}

Every Atlassian application has different scripts formats and workflow. We should have a common format guidelines to make them consistent between applications.

This will bring us the following wins:
* Sysadmins of Atlassian products will be able to configure any product in the same way, reducing the learning curve.
* Some pages in the documentation (and also the KB space) would be valid for all products, making them easier to maintain.

I personally like the way the files are formatted in JIRA (and Bamboo) but we should agree in a common format.
fields.summary: Get consistent start, stop, configuration and installation scripts across Atlassian products
As a JIRA Admin, I'd like to be able to export group members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34578].
  {panel}

Jira Version 6 incorporated the Detailed Views that allow editing issues directly from the Issue Navigator. -[JRA-7133|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7133]-

Users are requesting for fields to be editable directly from the field value.

*The reasons are:*
* [The moment you shift to details view from the list view, all you can read about the issue is it's name on the left side panel and details screen on the right side panel.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7133?focusedCommentId=488592&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-488592]
* this would be much easier
to edit than clicking on the cog icon or going to the detailed view screen
fields.summary: Allow field value editing directly in issue navigator
